text: how long should he hold eye contact
studies have shown that too little eye
contact makes a person feel left out but
too much can be uncomfortable and even
seem threatening so what's the socially
acceptable amount a team of london-based
researchers claim it's three point three
seconds give or take zero point seven
seconds the researchers tested 498
volunteers between the ages of 11 to 79
each one watched videos of someone
staring at them these videos had
different men and women staring for
different time periods
volunteers press the button when they
felt the gaze was too short or too long
mostly people preferred making eye
contact for about 3.3 seconds regardless
of sex and personality however
appearance did play a small role
volunteers preferred a shorter amount of
eye contact when they thought the person
in the video look threatening so the
next time you're on a date or in a
meeting remember you likely prefer a
similar amount of eye contact as the
person across from you
